meanings.definition: A device or software used to compare two values or objects.
meanings.sent1: The comparators in the program help us find the biggest number.
meanings.sent2: She used the comparators to see which product was cheaper.
meanings.sent3: The little robot comparators had a race to see who was faster.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like comparators, always seeking out the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept using colorful comparators on the board.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that compares.
meanings.sent1: The comparators in the office always had interesting opinions.
meanings.sent2: As a film critic, he was known as one of the toughest comparators.
meanings.sent3: The two cats were like comparators, always judging each other's actions.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like comparators, constantly weighing options.
meanings.sent5: The twins were natural comparators, always deciding who was better at different tasks.
